note.p: Birth: Smallfield, in the parish of Burstow, Surrey, England, Europe (c1615)
Death: The parish of St Paul, Covent Garden, London, England, Europe (15 December 1679)
Burial: The church of St Olave, Jewry, London, England, Europe
Education: Trinity College, Oxford; Lincoln's Inn (1627)

Career: Called to the Bar (1634); MP for Bletchingley (1640, 1661); Garter King of Arms (1643?-1660); Clarenceux King of Arms (1646); MP for Reigate, Surrey (1648); MP for Gatton, Surrey (1659); editor for number of works on heraldry (1654; 1665)
Other RSActivity: Solicited to contribute to the building of a Society College (1668)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Aubrey; ODNB

Notes: The election date is Bysshe's re-election date into the Society after the grant of the second charter in April 1663. All Fellows admitted in a two-month window after this charter, until 22 June 1663, are considered Original Fellows. He was previously elected on 19 November 1662.
